title: 110_hr3868
content:
There is no text provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk directly:

"DELAY OF EFFECTIVE DATES FOR SINGLE-EMPLOYER PLAN FUNDING RULES." The Pension Protection Act of 2006, the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 are amended to delay effective dates for single-employer plan funding rules. This includes changing the years mentioned in the sections to correspond with specific funding pre-effective date years, funding effective date years, and calendar years after the applicable funding effective date year as defined in section 1305 of the Pension Protection Act of 2006. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 delays effective dates for single-employer plan funding rules by adjusting calendar years in specific sections to align with funding effective date years as defined in section 1305 of the Act. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended by adding a new section at the end. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended by adding a new section at the end, which includes SEC. 1305 regarding Applicable Funding Effective Dates. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 defines the terms 'applicable funding pre-effective date year' as 2008 and 'applicable funding effective date year' as the year following the pre-effective date year. Subsection (a)(1) applies only if final regulations are issued by June 30, 2008, for specific sections of the Act and the Internal Revenue Code. The term 'applicable funding pre-effective date year' is defined as the first calendar year with all final regulations issued by June 30. The section will take effect upon the enactment of the Act and applies to specific sections of the Pension Protection Act of 2006 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 are amended by specific sections. The amendments apply to various subsections within both acts. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to change dates for determination of range and current liability. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to change dates for determination of range and current liability, including adjustments to PBGC premium rates and Internal Revenue Code provisions. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to change dates for determination of range and current liability, including adjustments to PBGC premium rates and Internal Revenue Code provisions by updating dates to the applicable funding effective date year. The Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004 and the Pension Protection Act of 2006 are amended to change dates for plan amendments and transition rules related to pension funding. The Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004 and the Pension Protection Act of 2006 are amended to change dates for plan amendments and transition rules related to pension funding. Specifically, amendments are made regarding funding notice requirements for plan years beginning after December 31 of the applicable funding pre-effective date year. The Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004 and the Pension Protection Act of 2006 are amended to change dates for plan amendments and transition rules related to pension funding. The repeal of notice and transition rule amendments apply to plan years beginning after December 31, 2006. The Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004 and the Pension Protection Act of 2006 are amended to change dates for plan amendments and transition rules related to pension funding. The repeal of notice and transition rule amendments apply to plan years beginning after December 31, 2006. Amendments include adjustments to funding percentages and reporting requirements. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended to change effective dates for plan years, with specific provisions for multiemployer plans. Conforming amendments are made regarding plan amendments, adjusting dates for compliance. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended to change effective dates for plan years, with specific provisions for multiemployer plans. Conforming amendments are made regarding deduction limits. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended to change effective dates for plan years, with specific provisions for multiemployer plans. Amendments apply to years beginning after December 31, 2007. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 amendments apply to plan years starting after December 31, 2007, with specific provisions for multiemployer plans regarding deductible limitations. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 amendments set deductible limitations for single-employer plans, excluding multiemployer plans. The deductible amount is determined based on the plan's current liability and assets. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 amendments include a conforming amendment regarding commercial airlines, specifying the application of sections based on effective date provisions. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if they were part of the Pension Protection Act of 2006.
